question_text: Which of the following are true about DKIM and its role in email security? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: DKIM uses cryptographic signatures in email headers
DKIM verifies that the email was sent from an authorized mail server
DKIM prevents email modification after sending
DKIM policies are published in DNS as TXT records
DKIM encrypts the entire email body
correct_answer: DKIM uses cryptographic signatures in email headers
DKIM prevents email modification after sending
DKIM policies are published in DNS as TXT records
explanation: DKIM verifies message integrity using cryptographic signatures stored in DNS TXT records, but does not encrypt full messages or confirm sending IPs.
